register.name: ICC_AP0R0
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Active Priorities Group 0 Registers
register.description: Provides information about Group 0 active priorities.

register.name: ICC_AP0R1
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Active Priorities Group 0 Registers
register.description: Provides information about Group 0 active priorities.

register.name: ICC_AP0R2
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Active Priorities Group 0 Registers
register.description: Provides information about Group 0 active priorities.

register.name: ICC_AP0R3
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Active Priorities Group 0 Registers
register.description: Provides information about Group 0 active priorities.

register.name: ICC_AP1R0
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Active Priorities Group 1 Registers
register.description: Provides information about Group 1 active priorities.

register.name: ICC_AP1R1
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Active Priorities Group 1 Registers
register.description: Provides information about Group 1 active priorities.

register.name: ICC_AP1R2
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Active Priorities Group 1 Registers
register.description: Provides information about Group 1 active priorities.

register.name: ICC_AP1R3
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Active Priorities Group 1 Registers
register.description: Provides information about Group 1 active priorities.

register.name: S_ICC_AP1R0
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Active Priorities Group 1 Registers
register.description: Provides information about Group 1 active priorities.

register.name: S_ICC_AP1R1
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Active Priorities Group 1 Registers
register.description: Provides information about Group 1 active priorities.

register.name: S_ICC_AP1R2
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Active Priorities Group 1 Registers
register.description: Provides information about Group 1 active priorities.

register.name: S_ICC_AP1R3
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Active Priorities Group 1 Registers
register.description: Provides information about Group 1 active priorities.

register.name: N_ICC_AP1R0
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Active Priorities Group 1 Registers
register.description: Provides information about Group 1 active priorities.

register.name: N_ICC_AP1R1
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Active Priorities Group 1 Registers
register.description: Provides information about Group 1 active priorities.

register.name: N_ICC_AP1R2
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Active Priorities Group 1 Registers
register.description: Provides information about Group 1 active priorities.

register.name: N_ICC_AP1R3
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Active Priorities Group 1 Registers
register.description: Provides information about Group 1 active priorities.

register.name: ICC_ASGI1R
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Alias Software Generated Interrupt Group 1 Register
register.description: Generates Group 1 SGIs for the Security state that is not the current Security state.

bitField.name: Aff3
bitField.description: The affinity 3 value of the affinity path of the cluster for which SGI interrupts will be generated.

bitField.name: IRM
bitField.description: Interrupt Routing Mode. Determines how the generated interrupts should be distributed to PEs.

bitField.name: Aff2
bitField.description: The affinity 2 value of the affinity path of the cluster for which SGI interrupts will be generated.

bitField.name: INTID
bitField.description: The interrupt ID of the SGI.

bitField.name: Aff1
bitField.description: The affinity 1 value of the affinity path of the cluster for which SGI interrupts will be generated.

bitField.name: TargetList
bitField.description: Target List. The set of PEs for which SGI interrupts will be generated. Each bit corresponds to the PE within a cluster with an Affinity 0 value equal to the bit number.

register.name: ICC_BPR0
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Binary Point Register 0
register.description: Defines the point at which the priority value fields split into two parts, the group priority field and the subpriority field. The group priority field determines Group 0 interrupt preemption.

bitField.name: BinaryPoint
bitField.description: The value of this field controls how the 8-bit interrupt priority field is split into a group priority field, that determines interrupt preemption, and a subpriority field.

register.name: ICC_BPR1
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Binary Point Register 1
register.description: Defines the point at which the priority value fields split into two parts, the group priority field and the subpriority field. The group priority field determines Group 1 interrupt preemption.

bitField.name: BinaryPoint
bitField.description: If the GIC is configured to use separate binary point fields for Group 0 and Group 1 interrupts, the value of this field controls how the 8-bit interrupt priority field is split into a group priority field, that determines interrupt preemption, and a subpriority field.

register.name: S_ICC_BPR1
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Binary Point Register 1
register.description: Defines the point at which the priority value fields split into two parts, the group priority field and the subpriority field. The group priority field determines Group 1 interrupt preemption.

bitField.name: BinaryPoint
bitField.description: If the GIC is configured to use separate binary point fields for Group 0 and Group 1 interrupts, the value of this field controls how the 8-bit interrupt priority field is split into a group priority field, that determines interrupt preemption, and a subpriority field.

register.name: N_ICC_BPR1
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Binary Point Register 1
register.description: Defines the point at which the priority value fields split into two parts, the group priority field and the subpriority field. The group priority field determines Group 1 interrupt preemption.

bitField.name: BinaryPoint
bitField.description: If the GIC is configured to use separate binary point fields for Group 0 and Group 1 interrupts, the value of this field controls how the 8-bit interrupt priority field is split into a group priority field, that determines interrupt preemption, and a subpriority field.

register.name: ICC_CTLR
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Control Register
register.description: Controls aspects of the behavior of the GIC CPU interface and provides information about the features implemented.

bitField.name: A3V
bitField.description: Affinity 3 Valid. Read-only and writes are ignored.

bitField.name: SEIS
bitField.description: SEI Support. Read-only and writes are ignored.

bitField.name: IDbits
bitField.description: Identifier bits. Read-only and writes are ignored.

bitField.name: PRIbits
bitField.description: Priority bits. Read-only and writes are ignored. The number of priority bits implemented, minus one.

bitField.name: EOImode
bitField.description: EOI mode for the current Security state.

register.name: S_ICC_CTLR
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Control Register
register.description: Controls aspects of the behavior of the GIC CPU interface and provides information about the features implemented.

bitField.name: A3V
bitField.description: Affinity 3 Valid. Read-only and writes are ignored.

bitField.name: SEIS
bitField.description: SEI Support. Read-only and writes are ignored.

bitField.name: IDbits
bitField.description: Identifier bits. Read-only and writes are ignored.

bitField.name: PRIbits
bitField.description: Priority bits. Read-only and writes are ignored. The number of priority bits implemented, minus one.

bitField.name: EOImode
bitField.description: EOI mode for the current Security state.

register.name: N_ICC_CTLR
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Control Register
register.description: Controls aspects of the behavior of the GIC CPU interface and provides information about the features implemented.

bitField.name: A3V
bitField.description: Affinity 3 Valid. Read-only and writes are ignored.

bitField.name: SEIS
bitField.description: SEI Support. Read-only and writes are ignored.

bitField.name: IDbits
bitField.description: Identifier bits. Read-only and writes are ignored.

bitField.name: PRIbits
bitField.description: Priority bits. Read-only and writes are ignored. The number of priority bits implemented, minus one.

bitField.name: EOImode
bitField.description: EOI mode for the current Security state.

register.name: ICC_DIR
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Deactivate Interrupt Register
register.description: When interrupt priority drop is separated from interrupt deactivation, a write to this register deactivates the specified interrupt.

bitField.name: INTID
bitField.description: The INTID of the interrupt to be deactivated.

register.name: ICC_EOIR0
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller End Of Interrupt Register 0
register.description: A PE writes to this register to inform the CPU interface that it has completed the processing of the specified Group 0 interrupt.

bitField.name: INTID
bitField.description: The interrupt ID from the corresponding ICC_IAR0 access.

register.name: ICC_EOIR1
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller End Of Interrupt Register 1
register.description: A PE writes to this register to inform the CPU interface that it has completed the processing of the specified Group 1 interrupt.

bitField.name: INTID
bitField.description: The interrupt ID from the corresponding ICC_IAR1 access.

register.name: ICC_HPPIR0
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Highest Priority Pending Interrupt Register 0
register.description: Indicates the highest priority pending Group 0 interrupt on the CPU interface.

bitField.name: INTID
bitField.description: The INTID of the highest priority pending interrupt, if that interrupt is observable at the current Security state and Exception level.

register.name: ICC_HPPIR1
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Highest Priority Pending Interrupt Register 1
register.description: Indicates the highest priority pending Group 1 interrupt on the CPU interface.

bitField.name: INTID
bitField.description: The INTID of the highest priority pending interrupt, if that interrupt is observable at the current Security state and Exception level.

register.name: ICC_HSRE
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Hyp System Register Enable register
register.description: Controls whether the System register interface or the memory-mapped interface to the GIC CPU interface is used for EL2.

bitField.name: Enable
bitField.description: Enable. Enables lower Exception level access to ICC_SRE.

register.name: ICC_IGRPEN0
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Interrupt Group 0 Enable register
register.description: Controls whether Group 0 interrupts are enabled or not.

register.name: ICC_IGRPEN1
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Interrupt Group 1 Enable register
register.description: Controls whether Group 1 interrupts are enabled for the current Security state.

bitField.name: Enable
bitField.description: Enables Group 1 interrupts for the current Security state.

register.name: S_ICC_IGRPEN1
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Interrupt Group 1 Enable register
register.description: Controls whether Group 1 interrupts are enabled for the current Security state.

bitField.name: Enable
bitField.description: Enables Group 1 interrupts for the current Security state.

register.name: N_ICC_IGRPEN1
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Interrupt Group 1 Enable register
register.description: Controls whether Group 1 interrupts are enabled for the current Security state.

bitField.name: Enable
bitField.description: Enables Group 1 interrupts for the current Security state.

register.name: ICC_MCTLR
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Monitor Control Register
register.description: Controls aspects of the behavior of the GIC CPU interface and provides information about the features implemented.

bitField.name: A3V
bitField.description: Affinity 3 Valid. Read-only and writes are ignored.

bitField.name: SEIS
bitField.description: SEI Support. Read-only and writes are ignored.

bitField.name: IDbits
bitField.description: Identifier bits. Read-only and writes are ignored.

bitField.name: PRIbits
bitField.description: Priority bits. Read-only and writes are ignored. The number of priority bits implemented, minus one.

bitField.name: EOImode_EL1NS
bitField.description: EOI mode for interrupts handled at Non-secure EL1 and EL2.

bitField.name: EOImode_EL1S
bitField.description: EOI mode for interrupts handled at Secure EL1.

bitField.name: EOImode_EL3
bitField.description: EOI mode for interrupts handled at EL3.

bitField.name: CBPR_EL1NS
bitField.description: Common Binary Point Register, EL1 Non-secure.

bitField.name: CBPR_EL1S
bitField.description: Common Binary Point Register, EL1 Secure.

register.name: ICC_MGRPEN1
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Monitor Interrupt Group 1 Enable register
register.description: Controls whether Group 1 interrupts are enabled or not.

bitField.name: EnableGrp1S
bitField.description: Enables Group 1 interrupts for the Secure state.

bitField.name: EnableGrp1NS
bitField.description: Enables Group 1 interrupts for the Non-secure state.

register.name: ICC_MSRE
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Monitor System Register Enable register
register.description: Controls whether the System register interface or the memory-mapped interface to the GIC CPU interface is used for EL3.

bitField.name: Enable
bitField.description: Enable. Enables lower Exception level access to ICC_SRE and ICC_HSRE.

register.name: ICC_PMR
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Interrupt Priority Mask Register
register.description: Provides an interrupt priority filter. Only interrupts with higher priority than the value in this register are signaled to the PE.

bitField.name: Priority
bitField.description: The priority mask level for the CPU interface. If the priority of an interrupt is higher than the value indicated by this field, the interface signals the interrupt to the PE.

register.name: ICC_RPR
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Running Priority Register
register.description: Indicates the Running priority of the CPU interface.

bitField.name: Priority
bitField.description: The current running priority on the CPU interface. This is the group priority of the current active interrupt.

register.name: ICC_SGI0R
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Software Generated Interrupt Group 0 Register
register.description: Generates Secure Group 0 SGIs, including from the Non-secure state when permitted by GICR_NSACR.

bitField.name: Aff3
bitField.description: The affinity 3 value of the affinity path of the cluster for which SGI interrupts will be generated.

bitField.name: IRM
bitField.description: Interrupt Routing Mode. Determines how the generated interrupts should be distributed to PEs.

bitField.name: Aff2
bitField.description: The affinity 2 value of the affinity path of the cluster for which SGI interrupts will be generated.

bitField.name: INTID
bitField.description: The interrupt ID of the SGI.

bitField.name: Aff1
bitField.description: The affinity 1 value of the affinity path of the cluster for which SGI interrupts will be generated.

bitField.name: TargetList
bitField.description: Target List. The set of PEs for which SGI interrupts will be generated. Each bit corresponds to the PE within a cluster with an Affinity 0 value equal to the bit number.

register.name: ICC_SGI1R
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Software Generated Interrupt Group 1 Register
register.description: Generates Group 1 SGIs for the current Security state.

bitField.name: Aff3
bitField.description: The affinity 3 value of the affinity path of the cluster for which SGI interrupts will be generated.

bitField.name: IRM
bitField.description: Interrupt Routing Mode. Determines how the generated interrupts should be distributed to PEs.

bitField.name: Aff2
bitField.description: The affinity 2 value of the affinity path of the cluster for which SGI interrupts will be generated.

bitField.name: INTID
bitField.description: The interrupt ID of the SGI.

bitField.name: Aff1
bitField.description: The affinity 1 value of the affinity path of the cluster for which SGI interrupts will be generated.

bitField.name: TargetList
bitField.description: Target List. The set of PEs for which SGI interrupts will be generated. Each bit corresponds to the PE within a cluster with an Affinity 0 value equal to the bit number.

register.name: ICC_SRE
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller System Register Enable register
register.description: Controls whether the System register interface or the memory-mapped interface to the GIC CPU interface is used for EL0 and EL1.

register.name: S_ICC_SRE
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller System Register Enable register
register.description: Controls whether the System register interface or the memory-mapped interface to the GIC CPU interface is used for EL0 and EL1.

register.name: N_ICC_SRE
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller System Register Enable register
register.description: Controls whether the System register interface or the memory-mapped interface to the GIC CPU interface is used for EL0 and EL1.

register.name: ICH_AP0R0
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Hyp Active Priorities Group 0 Registers
register.description: Provides information about Group 0 active priorities for EL2.

register.name: ICH_ELRSR
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Empty List Register Status Register
register.description: Indicates which List registers contain valid interrupts.

bitField.name: Status15

register.name: ICH_HCR
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Hyp Control Register
register.description: Controls the environment for Guest operating systems.

bitField.name: EOIcount
bitField.description: Counts the number of EOIs received that do not have a corresponding entry in the List registers. The virtual CPU interface increments this field automatically when a matching EOI is received.

bitField.name: TSEI
bitField.description: Trap all locally generated SEIs. This bit allows the hypervisor to intercept locally generated SEIs that would otherwise be taken at Non-secure EL1.

bitField.name: TALL1
bitField.description: Trap all Non-secure EL1 accesses to ICC_* System registers for Group 1 interrupts to EL2.

bitField.name: TALL0
bitField.description: Trap all Non-secure EL1 accesses to ICC_* System registers for Group 0 interrupts to EL2.

bitField.name: TC
bitField.description: Trap all Non-secure EL1 accesses to System registers that are common to Group 0 and Group 1 to EL2.

bitField.name: LRENPIE
bitField.description: List Register Entry Not Present Interrupt Enable.

register.description: Provides interrupt context information for the virtual CPU interface.

register.name: ICH_LRC0
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller List Registers
register.description: Provides interrupt context information for the virtual CPU interface.

bitField.name: HW
bitField.description: Indicates whether this virtual interrupt maps directly to a hardware interrupt, meaning that it corresponds to a physical interrupt. Deactivation of the virtual interrupt also causes the deactivation of the physical interrupt with the ID that the pINTID field indicates.

bitField.name: Group
bitField.description: Indicates the group for this virtual interrupt.

bitField.name: pINTID
bitField.description: Physical interrupt ID, for hardware interrupts.

bitField.name: pINTID

register.name: ICH_LRC9
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller List Registers
register.description: Provides interrupt context information for the virtual CPU interface.

bitField.name: HW
bitField.description: Indicates whether this virtual interrupt maps directly to a hardware interrupt, meaning that it corresponds to a physical interrupt. Deactivation of the virtual interrupt also causes the deactivation of the physical interrupt with the ID that the pINTID field indicates.

bitField.name: Group
bitField.description: Indicates the group for this virtual interrupt.

bitField.name: pINTID
bitField.description: Physical interrupt ID, for hardware interrupts.

register.name: ICH_LRC10
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller List Registers
register.description: Provides interrupt context information for the virtual CPU interface.

bitField.name: HW
bitField.description: Indicates whether this virtual interrupt maps directly to a hardware interrupt, meaning that it corresponds to a physical interrupt. Deactivation of the virtual interrupt also causes the deactivation of the physical interrupt with the ID that the pINTID field indicates.

bitField.name: Group
bitField.description: Indicates the group for this virtual interrupt.

bitField.name: pINTID
bitField.description: Physical interrupt ID, for hardware interrupts.

register.name: ICH_LRC11
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller List Registers
register.description: Provides interrupt context information for the virtual CPU interface.

bitField.name: HW
bitField.description: Indicates whether this virtual interrupt maps directly to a hardware interrupt, meaning that it corresponds to a physical interrupt. Deactivation of the virtual interrupt also causes the deactivation of the physical interrupt with the ID that the pINTID field indicates.

bitField.name: Group
bitField.description: Indicates the group for this virtual interrupt.

bitField.name: pINTID
bitField.description: Physical interrupt ID, for hardware interrupts.

register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller List Registers

bitField.name: HW
bitField.description: Indicates whether this virtual interrupt maps directly to a hardware interrupt, meaning that it corresponds to a physical interrupt. Deactivation of the virtual interrupt also causes the deactivation of the physical interrupt with the ID that the pINTID field indicates.

bitField.name: Group
bitField.description: Indicates the group for this virtual interrupt.

bitField.name: pINTID
bitField.description: Physical interrupt ID, for hardware interrupts.

bitField.name: HW
bitField.description: Indicates whether this virtual interrupt maps directly to a hardware interrupt, meaning that it corresponds to a physical interrupt. Deactivation of the virtual interrupt also causes the deactivation of the physical interrupt with the ID that the pINTID field indicates.

bitField.name: Group
bitField.description: Indicates the group for this virtual interrupt.

bitField.name: pINTID
bitField.description: Physical interrupt ID, for hardware interrupts.

register.description: Provides interrupt context information for the virtual CPU interface.

bitField.name: HW
bitField.description: Indicates whether this virtual interrupt maps directly to a hardware interrupt, meaning that it corresponds to a physical interrupt. Deactivation of the virtual interrupt also causes the deactivation of the physical interrupt with the ID that the pINTID field indicates.

bitField.name: Group
bitField.description: Indicates the group for this virtual interrupt.

bitField.name: pINTID
bitField.description: Physical interrupt ID, for hardware interrupts.

register.name: ICH_LRC15
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller List Registers
register.description: Provides interrupt context information for the virtual CPU interface.

bitField.name: HW
bitField.description: Indicates whether this virtual interrupt maps directly to a hardware interrupt, meaning that it corresponds to a physical interrupt. Deactivation of the virtual interrupt also causes the deactivation of the physical interrupt with the ID that the pINTID field indicates.

bitField.name: Group
bitField.description: Indicates the group for this virtual interrupt.

bitField.name: pINTID
bitField.description: Physical interrupt ID, for hardware interrupts.

register.name: ICH_MISR
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Maintenance Interrupt State Register
register.description: Indicates which maintenance interrupts are asserted.

register.name: ICH_VMCR
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Virtual Machine Control Register
register.description: Enables the hypervisor to save and restore the virtual machine view of the GIC state.

bitField.name: VPMR
bitField.description: Virtual Priority Mask. The priority mask level for the virtual CPU interface. If the priority of a pending virtual interrupt is higher than the value indicated by this field, the interface signals the virtual interrupt to the PE.

bitField.name: VBPR0
bitField.description: Virtual Binary Point Register, Group 0. Defines the point at which the priority value fields split into two parts, the group priority field and the subpriority field. The group priority field determines Group 0 interrupt preemption, and also determines Group 1 interrupt preemption if ICH_VMCR.VCBPR == 1.

bitField.name: VBPR1
bitField.description: Virtual Binary Point Register, Group 1. Defines the point at which the priority value fields split into two parts, the group priority field and the subpriority field. The group priority field determines Group 1 interrupt preemption if ICH_VMCR.VCBPR == 0.

register.name: ICH_VTR
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller VGIC Type Register
register.description: Describes the number of implemented virtual priority bits and List registers.

bitField.name: PRIbits
bitField.description: The number of virtual priority bits implemented, minus one.

bitField.name: PREbits
bitField.description: The number of virtual preemption bits implemented, minus one.

bitField.name: IDbits
bitField.description: The number of virtual interrupt identifier bits supported:

bitField.name: nV4
bitField.description: GICv4 direct injection of virtual interrupts not supported.

bitField.name: ListRegs
bitField.description: The number of implemented List registers, minus one. For example, a value of 0b01111 indicates that the maximum of 16 List registers are implemented.

tcf:enumItem.description: Interrupts routed to the PEs specified by Aff3.Aff2.Aff1.<target list>.
tcf:enumItem.name: Interrupts_routed_to_the_PEs_specified_by_Aff3

tcf:enumItem.description: Interrupts routed to all PEs in the system, excluding "self".
tcf:enumItem.name: Interrupts_routed_to_all_PEs_in_the_system_excluding_self

tcf:enumItem.description: The CPU interface logic only supports zero values of Affinity 3 in SGI generation System registers.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_CPU_interface_logic_only_supports_zero_values_of_Affinity_3_in_SGI_generation_System_registers

tcf:enumItem.description: The CPU interface logic supports non-zero values of Affinity 3 in SGI generation System registers.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_CPU_interface_logic_supports_non_zero_values_of_Affinity_3_in_SGI_generation_System_registers

tcf:enumItem.description: The CPU interface logic does not support local generation of SEIs by the CPU interface.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_CPU_interface_logic_does_not_support_local_generation_of_SEIs_by_the_CPU_interface

tcf:enumItem.description: The CPU interface logic supports local generation of SEIs by the CPU interface.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_CPU_interface_logic_supports_local_generation_of_SEIs_by_the_CPU_interface

tcf:enumItem.description: 16 bits.
tcf:enumItem.name: _16_bits

tcf:enumItem.description: 24 bits.
tcf:enumItem.name: _24_bits

tcf:enumItem.description: Disables use of ICC_PMR as a hint for interrupt distribution.
tcf:enumItem.name: Disables_use_of_ICC_PMR_as_a_hint_for_interrupt_distribution

tcf:enumItem.description: Enables use of ICC_PMR as a hint for interrupt distribution.
tcf:enumItem.name: Enables_use_of_ICC_PMR_as_a_hint_for_interrupt_distribution

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_EOIR0 and ICC_EOIR1 provide both priority drop and interrupt deactivation functionality. Accesses to ICC_DIR are UNPREDICTABLE.
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_EOIR0_and_ICC_EOIR1_provide_both_priority_drop_and_interrupt_deactivation_functionality

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_EOIR0 and ICC_EOIR1 provide priority drop functionality only. ICC_DIR provides interrupt deactivation functionality.
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_EOIR0_and_ICC_EOIR1_provide_priority_drop_functionality_only

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_BPR0 determines the preemption group for Group 0 interrupts only. ICC_BPR1 determines the preemption group for Group 1 interrupts.
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_BPR0_determines_the_preemption_group_for_Group_0_interrupts_only

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_BPR0 determines the preemption group for both Group 0 and Group 1 interrupts.
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_BPR0_determines_the_preemption_group_for_both_Group_0_and_Group_1_interrupts

tcf:enumItem.description: Non-secure EL1 accesses to ICC_SRE trap to EL2.
tcf:enumItem.name: Non_secure_EL1_accesses_to_ICC_SRE_trap_to_EL2

tcf:enumItem.description: Non-secure EL1 accesses to ICC_SRE do not trap to EL2.
tcf:enumItem.name: Non_secure_EL1_accesses_to_ICC_SRE_do_not_trap_to_EL2

tcf:enumItem.description: IRQ bypass enabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: IRQ_bypass_enabled

tcf:enumItem.description: IRQ bypass disabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: IRQ_bypass_disabled

tcf:enumItem.description: FIQ bypass enabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: FIQ_bypass_enabled

tcf:enumItem.description: FIQ bypass disabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: FIQ_bypass_disabled

tcf:enumItem.description: The memory-mapped interface must be used. Access at EL2 or below to any ICH_* System register, or any EL1 or EL2 ICC_* register other than ICC_SRE or ICC_HSRE, results in an Undefined Instruction exception.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_memory_mapped_interface_must_be_used

tcf:enumItem.description: The System register interface to the ICH_* registers and the EL1 and EL2 ICC_* registers is enabled for EL2.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_System_register_interface_to_the_ICH_registers_and_the_EL1_and_EL2_ICC_registers_is_enabled_for_EL2

tcf:enumItem.description: Group 0 interrupts are disabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: Group_0_interrupts_are_disabled

tcf:enumItem.description: Group 0 interrupts are enabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: Group_0_interrupts_are_enabled

tcf:enumItem.description: Group 1 interrupts are disabled for the current Security state.
tcf:enumItem.name: Group_1_interrupts_are_disabled_for_the_current_Security_state

tcf:enumItem.description: Group 1 interrupts are enabled for the current Security state.
tcf:enumItem.name: Group_1_interrupts_are_enabled_for_the_current_Security_state

tcf:enumItem.description: The CPU interface logic supports disabling of security.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_CPU_interface_logic_supports_disabling_of_security

tcf:enumItem.description: The CPU interface logic does not support disabling of security, and requires that security is not disabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_CPU_interface_logic_does_not_support_disabling_of_security_and_requires_that_security_is_not_disabled

tcf:enumItem.description: The CPU interface logic does not support non-zero values of the Aff3 field in SGI generation System registers.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_CPU_interface_logic_does_not_support_non_zero_values_of_the_Aff3_field_in_SGI_generation_System_registers

tcf:enumItem.description: The CPU interface logic supports non-zero values of the Aff3 field in SGI generation System registers.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_CPU_interface_logic_supports_non_zero_values_of_the_Aff3_field_in_SGI_generation_System_registers

tcf:enumItem.description: The CPU interface logic does not support generation of SEIs.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_CPU_interface_logic_does_not_support_generation_of_SEIs

tcf:enumItem.description: The CPU interface logic supports generation of SEIs.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_CPU_interface_logic_supports_generation_of_SEIs

tcf:enumItem.description: 16 bits.
tcf:enumItem.name: _16_bits

tcf:enumItem.description: 24 bits.
tcf:enumItem.name: _24_bits

tcf:enumItem.description: Disables use of the priority mask register as a hint for interrupt distribution.
tcf:enumItem.name: Disables_use_of_the_priority_mask_register_as_a_hint_for_interrupt_distribution

tcf:enumItem.description: Enables use of the priority mask register as a hint for interrupt distribution.
tcf:enumItem.name: Enables_use_of_the_priority_mask_register_as_a_hint_for_interrupt_distribution

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_EOIR0 and ICC_EOIR1 provide both priority drop and interrupt deactivation functionality. Accesses to ICC_DIR are UNPREDICTABLE.
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_EOIR0_and_ICC_EOIR1_provide_both_priority_drop_and_interrupt_deactivation_functionality

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_EOIR0 and ICC_EOIR1 provide priority drop functionality only. ICC_DIR provides interrupt deactivation functionality.
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_EOIR0_and_ICC_EOIR1_provide_priority_drop_functionality_only

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_EOIR0 and ICC_EOIR1 provide both priority drop and interrupt deactivation functionality. Accesses to ICC_DIR are UNPREDICTABLE.
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_EOIR0_and_ICC_EOIR1_provide_both_priority_drop_and_interrupt_deactivation_functionality

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_EOIR0 and ICC_EOIR1 provide priority drop functionality only. ICC_DIR provides interrupt deactivation functionality.
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_EOIR0_and_ICC_EOIR1_provide_priority_drop_functionality_only

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_EOIR0 and ICC_EOIR1 provide both priority drop and interrupt deactivation functionality. Accesses to ICC_DIR are UNPREDICTABLE.
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_EOIR0_and_ICC_EOIR1_provide_both_priority_drop_and_interrupt_deactivation_functionality

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_EOIR0 and ICC_EOIR1 provide priority drop functionality only. ICC_DIR provides interrupt deactivation functionality.
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_EOIR0_and_ICC_EOIR1_provide_priority_drop_functionality_only

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_BPR0 determines the preemption group for Group 0 interrupts only. ICC_BPR1 determines the preemption group for Non-secure Group 1 interrupts.
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_BPR0_determines_the_preemption_group_for_Group_0_interrupts_only

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_BPR0 determines the preemption group for Group 0 interrupts and Non-secure Group 1 interrupts. Non-secure accesses to GICC_BPR and ICC_BPR1 access the state of ICC_BPR0.
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_BPR0_determines_the_preemption_group_for_Group_0_interrupts_and_Non_secure_Group_1_interrupts

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_BPR0 determines the preemption group for Group 0 interrupts only. ICC_BPR1 determines the preemption group for Secure Group 1 interrupts.
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_BPR0_determines_the_preemption_group_for_Group_0_interrupts_only

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_BPR0 determines the preemption group for Group 0 interrupts and Secure Group 1 interrupts. Secure accesses to ICC_BPR1 access the state of ICC_BPR0.
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_BPR0_determines_the_preemption_group_for_Group_0_interrupts_and_Secure_Group_1_interrupts

tcf:enumItem.description: Secure Group 1 interrupts are disabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: Secure_Group_1_interrupts_are_disabled

tcf:enumItem.description: Secure Group 1 interrupts are enabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: Secure_Group_1_interrupts_are_enabled

tcf:enumItem.description: Non-secure Group 1 interrupts are disabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: Non_secure_Group_1_interrupts_are_disabled

tcf:enumItem.description: Non-secure Group 1 interrupts are enabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: Non_secure_Group_1_interrupts_are_enabled

tcf:enumItem.description: Secure EL1 accesses to Secure ICC_SRE trap to EL3. EL2 accesses to Non-secure ICC_SRE and ICC_HSRE trap to EL3. Non-secure EL1 accesses to ICC_SRE trap to EL3, unless these accesses are trapped to EL2 as a result of ICC_MSRE.Enable == 0.
tcf:enumItem.name: Secure_EL1_accesses_to_Secure_ICC_SRE_trap_to_EL3

tcf:enumItem.description: Secure EL1 accesses to Secure ICC_SRE do not trap to EL3. EL2 accesses to Non-secure ICC_SRE and ICC_HSRE do not trap to EL3. Non-secure EL1 accesses to ICC_SRE do not trap to EL3.
tcf:enumItem.name: Secure_EL1_accesses_to_Secure_ICC_SRE_do_not_trap_to_EL3

tcf:enumItem.description: IRQ bypass enabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: IRQ_bypass_enabled

tcf:enumItem.description: IRQ bypass disabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: IRQ_bypass_disabled

tcf:enumItem.description: FIQ bypass enabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: FIQ_bypass_enabled

tcf:enumItem.description: FIQ bypass disabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: FIQ_bypass_disabled

tcf:enumItem.description: The memory-mapped interface must be used. Access at EL3 or below to any ICH_* System register, or any EL1, EL2, or EL3 ICC_* register other than ICC_SRE, ICC_HSRE, or ICC_MSRE, results in an Undefined Instruction exception.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_memory_mapped_interface_must_be_used

tcf:enumItem.description: The System register interface to the ICH_* registers and the EL1, EL2, and EL3 ICC_* registers is enabled for EL3.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_System_register_interface_to_the_ICH_registers_and_the_EL1_EL2_and_EL3_ICC_registers_is_enabled_for_EL3

tcf:enumItem.description: Interrupts routed to the PEs specified by Aff3.Aff2.Aff1.<target list>.
tcf:enumItem.name: Interrupts_routed_to_the_PEs_specified_by_Aff3

tcf:enumItem.description: Interrupts routed to all PEs in the system, excluding "self".
tcf:enumItem.name: Interrupts_routed_to_all_PEs_in_the_system_excluding_self

tcf:enumItem.description: Interrupts routed to the PEs specified by Aff3.Aff2.Aff1.<target list>.
tcf:enumItem.name: Interrupts_routed_to_the_PEs_specified_by_Aff3

tcf:enumItem.description: Interrupts routed to all PEs in the system, excluding "self".
tcf:enumItem.name: Interrupts_routed_to_all_PEs_in_the_system_excluding_self

tcf:enumItem.description: IRQ bypass enabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: IRQ_bypass_enabled

tcf:enumItem.description: IRQ bypass disabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: IRQ_bypass_disabled

tcf:enumItem.description: FIQ bypass enabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: FIQ_bypass_enabled

tcf:enumItem.description: FIQ bypass disabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: FIQ_bypass_disabled

tcf:enumItem.description: The memory-mapped interface must be used. Access at EL1 to any ICC_* System register other than ICC_SRE results in an Undefined Instruction exception.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_memory_mapped_interface_must_be_used

tcf:enumItem.description: The System register interface for the current Security state is enabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_System_register_interface_for_the_current_Security_state_is_enabled

tcf:enumItem.description: There is no Group 0 interrupt active at the priority corresponding to that bit.
tcf:enumItem.name: There_is_no_Group_0_interrupt_active_at_the_priority_corresponding_to_that_bit

tcf:enumItem.description: There is a Group 0 interrupt active at the priority corresponding to that bit.
tcf:enumItem.name: There_is_a_Group_0_interrupt_active_at_the_priority_corresponding_to_that_bit

tcf:enumItem.description: There is no Group 1 interrupt active at the priority corresponding to that bit.
tcf:enumItem.name: There_is_no_Group_1_interrupt_active_at_the_priority_corresponding_to_that_bit

tcf:enumItem.description: There is a Group 1 interrupt active at the priority corresponding to that bit.
tcf:enumItem.name: There_is_a_Group_1_interrupt_active_at_the_priority_corresponding_to_that_bit

tcf:enumItem.description: List register <n>, ICH_LR<n>, does not have an EOI maintenance interrupt.
tcf:enumItem.name: List_register_n_ICH_LR_n_does_not_have_an_EOI_maintenance_interrupt

tcf:enumItem.description: List register <n>, ICH_LR<n>, has an EOI maintenance interrupt that has not been handled.
tcf:enumItem.name: List_register_n_ICH_LR_n_has_an_EOI_maintenance_interrupt_that_has_not_been_handled

tcf:enumItem.description: List register ICH_LR<n>, if implemented, contains a valid interrupt. Using this List register can result in overwriting a valid interrupt.
tcf:enumItem.name: List_register_ICH_LR_n_if_implemented_contains_a_valid_interrupt

tcf:enumItem.description: List register ICH_LR<n> does not contain a valid interrupt. The List register is empty and can be used without overwriting a valid interrupt or losing an EOI maintenance interrupt.
tcf:enumItem.name: List_register_ICH_LR_n_does_not_contain_a_valid_interrupt

tcf:enumItem.description: Locally generated SEIs do not cause a trap to EL2.
tcf:enumItem.name: Locally_generated_SEIs_do_not_cause_a_trap_to_EL2

tcf:enumItem.description: Locally generated SEIs trap to EL2.
tcf:enumItem.name: Locally_generated_SEIs_trap_to_EL2

tcf:enumItem.description: Non-Secure EL1 accesses to ICC_* registers for Group 1 interrupts proceed as normal.
tcf:enumItem.name: Non_Secure_EL1_accesses_to_ICC_registers_for_Group_1_interrupts_proceed_as_normal

tcf:enumItem.description: Any Non-secure EL1 accesses to ICC_* registers for Group 1 interrupts trap to EL2.
tcf:enumItem.name: Any_Non_secure_EL1_accesses_to_ICC_registers_for_Group_1_interrupts_trap_to_EL2

tcf:enumItem.description: Non-Secure EL1 accesses to ICC_* registers for Group 0 interrupts proceed as normal.
tcf:enumItem.name: Non_Secure_EL1_accesses_to_ICC_registers_for_Group_0_interrupts_proceed_as_normal

tcf:enumItem.description: Any Non-secure EL1 accesses to ICC_* registers for Group 0 interrupts trap to EL2.
tcf:enumItem.name: Any_Non_secure_EL1_accesses_to_ICC_registers_for_Group_0_interrupts_trap_to_EL2

tcf:enumItem.description: Non-secure EL1 accesses to common registers proceed as normal.
tcf:enumItem.name: Non_secure_EL1_accesses_to_common_registers_proceed_as_normal

tcf:enumItem.description: Any Non-secure EL1 accesses to common registers trap to EL2.
tcf:enumItem.name: Any_Non_secure_EL1_accesses_to_common_registers_trap_to_EL2

tcf:enumItem.description: Maintenance interrupt disabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: Maintenance_interrupt_disabled

tcf:enumItem.description: Maintenance interrupt signaled when ICH_VMCR.VENG1 is 0.
tcf:enumItem.name: Maintenance_interrupt_signaled_when_ICH_VMCR

tcf:enumItem.description: Maintenance interrupt disabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: Maintenance_interrupt_disabled

tcf:enumItem.description: Maintenance interrupt signaled when ICH_VMCR.VENG1 is 1.
tcf:enumItem.name: Maintenance_interrupt_signaled_when_ICH_VMCR

tcf:enumItem.description: Maintenance interrupt disabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: Maintenance_interrupt_disabled

tcf:enumItem.description: Maintenance interrupt signaled when ICH_VMCR.VENG0 is 0.
tcf:enumItem.name: Maintenance_interrupt_signaled_when_ICH_VMCR

tcf:enumItem.description: Maintenance interrupt disabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: Maintenance_interrupt_disabled

tcf:enumItem.description: Maintenance interrupt signaled when ICH_VMCR.VENG0 is 1.
tcf:enumItem.name: Maintenance_interrupt_signaled_when_ICH_VMCR

tcf:enumItem.description: Maintenance interrupt disabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: Maintenance_interrupt_disabled

tcf:enumItem.description: Maintenance interrupt signaled while the List registers contain no interrupts in the pending state.
tcf:enumItem.name: Maintenance_interrupt_signaled_while_the_List_registers_contain_no_interrupts_in_the_pending_state

tcf:enumItem.description: Maintenance interrupt disabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: Maintenance_interrupt_disabled

tcf:enumItem.description: Maintenance interrupt is asserted while the EOIcount field is not 0.
tcf:enumItem.name: Maintenance_interrupt_is_asserted_while_the_EOIcount_field_is_not_0

tcf:enumItem.description: Maintenance interrupt disabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: Maintenance_interrupt_disabled

tcf:enumItem.description: Maintenance interrupt is asserted if none, or only one, of the List register entries is marked as a valid interrupt.
tcf:enumItem.name: Maintenance_interrupt_is_asserted_if_none_or_only_one_of_the_List_register_entries_is_marked_as_a_valid_interrupt

tcf:enumItem.description: Virtual CPU interface operation disabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: Virtual_CPU_interface_operation_disabled

tcf:enumItem.description: Virtual CPU interface operation enabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: Virtual_CPU_interface_operation_enabled

tcf:enumItem.description: Pending and active.
tcf:enumItem.name: Pending_and_active

tcf:enumItem.description: The interrupt is triggered entirely by software. No notification is sent to the Distributor when the virtual interrupt is deactivated.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_interrupt_is_triggered_entirely_by_software

tcf:enumItem.description: The interrupt maps directly to a hardware interrupt. A deactivate interrupt request is sent to the Distributor when the virtual interrupt is deactivated, using the pINTID field from this register to indicate the physical interrupt ID. If ICH_VMCR.VEOIM is 0, this request corresponds to a write to ICC_EOIR0 or ICC_EOIR1. Otherwise, it corresponds to a write to ICC_DIR.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_interrupt_maps_directly_to_a_hardware_interrupt

tcf:enumItem.description: This is a Group 0 virtual interrupt. ICH_VMCR.VFIQEn determines whether it is signaled as a virtual IRQ or as a virtual FIQ, and ICH_VMCR.VENG0 enables signaling of this interrupt to the virtual machine.
tcf:enumItem.name: This_is_a_Group_0_virtual_interrupt

tcf:enumItem.description: This is a Group 1 virtual interrupt, signaled as a virtual IRQ. ICH_VMCR.VENG1 enables the signaling of this interrupt to the virtual machine. If ICH_VMCR.VCBPR is 0, then ICC_BPR1 determines if a pending Group 1 interrupt has sufficient priority to preempt current execution. Otherwise, ICC_BPR0 determines preemption.
tcf:enumItem.name: This_is_a_Group_1_virtual_interrupt_signaled_as_a_virtual_IRQ

tcf:enumItem.description: VM Group 1 Disabled maintenance interrupt not asserted.
tcf:enumItem.name: VM_Group_1_Disabled_maintenance_interrupt_not_asserted

tcf:enumItem.description: VM Group 1 Disabled maintenance interrupt asserted.
tcf:enumItem.name: VM_Group_1_Disabled_maintenance_interrupt_asserted

tcf:enumItem.description: VM Group 1 Enabled maintenance interrupt not asserted.
tcf:enumItem.name: VM_Group_1_Enabled_maintenance_interrupt_not_asserted

tcf:enumItem.description: VM Group 1 Enabled maintenance interrupt asserted.
tcf:enumItem.name: VM_Group_1_Enabled_maintenance_interrupt_asserted

tcf:enumItem.description: VM Group 0 Disabled maintenance interrupt not asserted.
tcf:enumItem.name: VM_Group_0_Disabled_maintenance_interrupt_not_asserted

tcf:enumItem.description: VM Group 0 Disabled maintenance interrupt asserted.
tcf:enumItem.name: VM_Group_0_Disabled_maintenance_interrupt_asserted

tcf:enumItem.description: VM Group 0 Enabled maintenance interrupt not asserted.
tcf:enumItem.name: VM_Group_0_Enabled_maintenance_interrupt_not_asserted

tcf:enumItem.description: VM Group 0 Enabled maintenance interrupt asserted.
tcf:enumItem.name: VM_Group_0_Enabled_maintenance_interrupt_asserted

tcf:enumItem.description: No Pending maintenance interrupt not asserted.
tcf:enumItem.name: No_Pending_maintenance_interrupt_not_asserted

tcf:enumItem.description: No Pending maintenance interrupt asserted.
tcf:enumItem.name: No_Pending_maintenance_interrupt_asserted

tcf:enumItem.description: List Register Entry Not Present maintenance interrupt not asserted.
tcf:enumItem.name: List_Register_Entry_Not_Present_maintenance_interrupt_not_asserted

tcf:enumItem.description: List Register Entry Not Present maintenance interrupt asserted.
tcf:enumItem.name: List_Register_Entry_Not_Present_maintenance_interrupt_asserted

tcf:enumItem.description: Underflow maintenance interrupt not asserted.
tcf:enumItem.name: Underflow_maintenance_interrupt_not_asserted

tcf:enumItem.description: Underflow maintenance interrupt asserted.
tcf:enumItem.name: Underflow_maintenance_interrupt_asserted

tcf:enumItem.description: End Of Interrupt maintenance interrupt not asserted.
tcf:enumItem.name: End_Of_Interrupt_maintenance_interrupt_not_asserted

tcf:enumItem.description: End Of Interrupt maintenance interrupt asserted.
tcf:enumItem.name: End_Of_Interrupt_maintenance_interrupt_asserted

tcf:enumItem.description: A write of an INTID to ICC_EOIR0 or ICC_EOIR1 drops the priority of the interrupt with that INTID, and also deactivates that interrupt.
tcf:enumItem.name: A_write_of_an_INTID_to_ICC_EOIR0_or_ICC_EOIR1_drops_the_priority_of_the_interrupt_with_that_INTID_and_also_deactivates_that_interrupt

tcf:enumItem.description: A write of an INTID to ICC_EOIR0 or ICC_EOIR1 only drops the priority of the interrupt with that INTID. Software must write to ICC_DIR to deactivate the interrupt.
tcf:enumItem.name: A_write_of_an_INTID_to_ICC_EOIR0_or_ICC_EOIR1_only_drops_the_priority_of_the_interrupt_with_that_INTID

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_BPR1 determines the preemption group for Non-secure Group 1 interrupts.
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_BPR1_determines_the_preemption_group_for_Non_secure_Group_1_interrupts

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_BPR0 determines the preemption group for Non-secure Group 1 interrupts. Non-secure accesses to GICC_BPR and ICC_BPR1 access the state of ICC_BPR0.
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_BPR0_determines_the_preemption_group_for_Non_secure_Group_1_interrupts

tcf:enumItem.description: Group 0 virtual interrupts are presented as virtual IRQs.
tcf:enumItem.name: Group_0_virtual_interrupts_are_presented_as_virtual_IRQs

tcf:enumItem.description: Group 0 virtual interrupts are presented as virtual FIQs.
tcf:enumItem.name: Group_0_virtual_interrupts_are_presented_as_virtual_FIQs

tcf:enumItem.description: If the highest priority pending interrupt is Group 1, a read of GICV_IAR or GICV_HPPIR returns an interrupt ID of 1022.
tcf:enumItem.name: If_the_highest_priority_pending_interrupt_is_Group_1_a_read_of_GICV_IAR_or_GICV_HPPIR_returns_an_interrupt_ID_of_1022

tcf:enumItem.description: If the highest priority pending interrupt is Group 1, a read of GICV_IAR or GICV_HPPIR returns the interrupt ID of the corresponding interrupt.
tcf:enumItem.name: If_the_highest_priority_pending_interrupt_is_Group_1_a_read_of_GICV_IAR_or_GICV_HPPIR_returns_the_interrupt_ID_of_the_corresponding_interrupt

tcf:enumItem.description: Group 1 virtual interrupts are disabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: Group_1_virtual_interrupts_are_disabled

tcf:enumItem.description: Group 1 virtual interrupts are enabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: Group_1_virtual_interrupts_are_enabled

tcf:enumItem.description: Group 0 virtual interrupts are disabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: Group_0_virtual_interrupts_are_disabled

tcf:enumItem.description: Group 0 virtual interrupts are enabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: Group_0_virtual_interrupts_are_enabled

tcf:enumItem.description: 16 bits.
tcf:enumItem.name: _16_bits

tcf:enumItem.description: 24 bits.
tcf:enumItem.name: _24_bits

tcf:enumItem.description: The virtual CPU interface logic does not support generation of SEIs.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_virtual_CPU_interface_logic_does_not_support_generation_of_SEIs

tcf:enumItem.description: The virtual CPU interface logic supports generation of SEIs.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_virtual_CPU_interface_logic_supports_generation_of_SEIs

tcf:enumItem.description: The virtual CPU interface logic only supports zero values of Affinity 3 in SGI generation System registers.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_virtual_CPU_interface_logic_only_supports_zero_values_of_Affinity_3_in_SGI_generation_System_registers

tcf:enumItem.description: The virtual CPU interface logic supports non-zero values of Affinity 3 in SGI generation System registers.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_virtual_CPU_interface_logic_supports_non_zero_values_of_Affinity_3_in_SGI_generation_System_registers

tcf:enumItem.description: The CPU interface logic supports direct injection of virtual interrupts.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_CPU_interface_logic_supports_direct_injection_of_virtual_interrupts

tcf:enumItem.description: The CPU interface logic does not support direct injection of virtual interrupts.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_CPU_interface_logic_does_not_support_direct_injection_of_virtual_interrupts
